item.title: Peer Tutoring Guidelines for COS 126, 226 & 217
item.description: Last revised: October 3, 2022, originally from here. Congratulations on becoming a peer tutor! Please confirm that you understand these guidelines before you start tutoring by completing this affirmation form. As a peer tutor, you have permission to look at the code of the person you are tutoring. It’s important, however, that you avoid looking at your own solutions while tutoring. That could inadvertently influence you to guide your student to a solution that would be so close to your old code that it would be flagged by the plagiarism software.
